page.title: 20ST.LEONARD'S CHURCH,MONYASH
page.content: {St.Leonard's Church}was built in the year 1200 with just a chancel and a nave.In the 14th century a tower and north and south transepts were added. There is a{lady chapel}in the south transept. The whole church was restored in 1884-1887 by{William Butterfield}at a cost of Â£3,000-Â£4,000. { Services}are held on Sunday mornings at 9.15 am.Only about 8-12 people attend every Sunday _ not as many as there used to be.There is no longer an evening service. { }There is also a{Methodist Chapel which was built in 1883 and extended in 1885.Services are held on Sunday from 2-3.00 p.m. or 4-5.00 p.m. with an average of 10 people attending. Ministers come from Buxton to take the services.
